projects.description: GDC completed a Detailed Seismic Assessment (DSA) report and Seismic Strengthening Design to achieve 67% NBS. GDC completed Structural Design for the new block extension, Seismic Strengthening CAD Drawings, Emergency Lighting Design, and an Electrical Capacity Assessment for this project.

projects.title: The Lost Springs, Whitianga, Coromandel, Waikato
points: Stage 1:GDC completed an Architectural 3D Model, Architectural Drawings for lodging Building Consent (including walkway additions, clamshell pool, and attached deck), and applied for Building Consent.

Stage 2:GDC completed Architectural Drawings, a Resource Consent application, a Three Waters Assessment Report, an Acoustics Report, a Traffic Report, an Architectural 3D Model for the Existing and Proposed stages, Soakage Testing and Report, and Emergency Lighting Design.

Phase 1 and 2:GDC completed Geotechnical CPT testing, a Fire Report, Structural Design for the steel structure, wall and roof bracing, Structural Design for Phase 2, a PS2 Peer Review, Footpath Structure Design, Piles and Footing Design, and Elevated Deck Structure Design.

projects.title: Buckland Road Playground, Tuakau, Waikato
projects.jobDescription: GDC provided Stage 1 Detailed Design services for this project. This included preparing detailed design drawings with finished and existing ground levels, creating 3D animations with profiles, and providing specifications. GDC also prepared engineering estimates, schedules of quantities, soakage testing and design (including one compulsory and three provisional tests), conducted a profile survey, prepared an erosion and sediment control plan, completed a detailed survey, conducted a geotechnical investigation and report, and lodged a resource consent application.

projects.title: Rere School, Gisborne
projects.jobDescription: GDC completed Concept Design (Structural Engineering), Construction Monitoring, and the issuance of PS4 certification for this project. Additionally, GDC undertook tasks related to extending the existing retaining wall, designing a new retaining wall around car park areas, and delivering Preliminary and Developed Design.

Whakatāne Campus, 33 Cutler Crescent, Whakatāne: GDC completed Test Piles Inspection, Pavement Design, Foundation Design, Geotechnical Testing and Report, Stormwater Testing, and a Stormwater Management Report. GDC also issued PS4 certification for this project.

projects.title: Te Kauwhata Domain Walkway, Waikato
projects.jobDescription: GDC completed a Site Analysis Design, a cost comparison between concrete and hoggin, a set of construction drawings, a developed report of specifications, a schedule of items, and developed drawings to inform the community. GDC also conducted a topographical survey for construction. GDC provided an engineer's estimate, a Geotechnical Investigation & Report, and assistance with identifying and removing high-risk trees. Additional services included the installation of provisional sight rails near open drains and parts of Track 2, estimates for hoggin on Tracks 4 and 5, and alterations to Tracks 10–12. GDC also created aesthetic design imagery for presentation to the local community.

projects.title: Tennis Courts (Opuatia Court, Pukekawa Court, Tuakau Court, Ruawaro Court)
points: Ruawaro Tennis Court:GDC completed surveying, an initial site assessment and report, further site assessment of the subbase and subgrade, a stormwater plan and design, and the design of a concrete base. GDC also provided a schedule of quantities and conducted site inspections.

Opuatia Tennis Court:GDC completed an initial site assessment and report, a stormwater plan and design, and the design of a replacement concrete pad. GDC also prepared a schedule of quantities and conducted site inspections.
Pukekawa Tennis Court:GDC completed an initial site assessment and report, a stormwater plan and design, a schedule of quantities, and site inspections.

Tuakau Courts:GDC completed an initial site assessment, including scanning of the block wall, a stormwater site assessment, a stormwater plan and design, and advice on the pothole infill plan before turfing. GDC also prepared a schedule of quantities and conducted site inspections.

projects.title: Ngāruawāhia Dog Pound, Waikato
projects.jobDescription: GDC prepared a Resource Consent Application with an Environmental Assessment, an Acoustic Report, and Architectural Concept Design and Plans (including designs for the carpark). GDC also conducted a geotechnical investigation for the building and car park, provided a 3 Waters Assessment Report, and completed a Field Survey / Topo Survey. Additionally, GDC provided Structural Design Drawings and Documentation, Three Waters Design Drawings and Documentation (including carpark), a Fire Design Report, Lighting Design, and a Schedule of Quantities. GDC also applied for Building Consent as part of the project scope.

projects.title: Ngāruawāhia War Memorial Hall 5 Galileo Street, Ngāruawāhia, Waikato
points: Stage 1 - Detailed Seismic Assessment:  GDC completed a comprehensive review of as-built drawings for existing building records and undertook an on-site X-ray Ferro Scan to analyse reinforcing details. GDC set up a computational model, where required, to evaluate loads, effects, and critical weaknesses with accuracy and confidence for analysis. Structural Analysis and Computations were performed to derive the NBS (%) for the building, adhering to the Unreinforced Masonry Manual (July 2017). GDC recommended retrofitting measures, to achieve 67% NBS compliance. A Detailed Seismic Assessment (DSA) report, including recommendations for associated works was provided for this project.

Ngaruawahia Memorial Hall Improvement Works: GDC provided services to enhance the functionality and atmosphere of the hall, addressing needs such as heating, floor re-coating, lighting improvements, and accessibility upgrades to the toilets, kitchen, and access ramp. GDC undertook site visits, prepared architectural plans, and developed electrical and services improvement design drawings. These were packaged for submission for Building Consent. Additionally, GDC prepared Building Consent Documentation for Architectural and Electrical Engineering and applied for the Building Consent Application.

points: GDC completed a comprehensive review of as-built drawings for existing building records and undertook an on-site X-ray Ferro Scan to analyse reinforcing details.
GDC set up a computational model, where required, to evaluate loads, effects, and critical weaknesses with accuracy and confidence for analysis.
Structural Analysis and Computations were performed to derive the NBS (%) for the building, adhering to the Unreinforced Masonry Manual (July 2017).
GDC recommended retrofitting measures, to achieve 67% NBS compliance.
A Detailed Seismic Assessment (DSA) report, including recommendations for associated works was provided for this project.

projects.title: Paeroa Medical Centre, Waikato
projects.jobDescription: GDC completed Concrete Scanning and Verification, Structural Design and Detailing, Geotechnical Investigation and Report, site inspections, and the issuance of PS4 certification for this project
